throttle.translation[0].definitions[0].d: to kill or injure someone by holding their throat very tightly so that they cannot breathe
throttle.translation[0].definitions[0].e: He grabbed her by the throat and began throttling her.
throttle.translation[0].definitions[1].d: to make it difficult or impossible for something to succeed
throttle.translation[0].definitions[1].e: policies which are throttling many Asian economies
throttle.translation[0].definitions[2].d: to slow down the speed of an Internet connection
